common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine Activation Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties enabling the Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine.  The issue manifests as either an inability to activate the engine or the LTM feature not functioning as expected despite appearing to be enabled.  Proposed solutions include checking for software updates, ensuring user authentication, and providing detailed logs to the support team for further analysis.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@Iliya3ProX) reported an issue with the Long-Term Memory (LTM) engine not turning on.
* The user provided a video demonstrating the problem.
* The issue was identified as a bug causing downloaded LLM state to override saved data.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support bot suggested checking related issues and provided helpful resources.
* A Pieces team member (@mason-at-pieces) requested user logs for further investigation.
* Another team member (@mack-at-pieces) confirmed the bug and announced a patch release.
* The fix was deployed in version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the Desktop application.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user (@Iliya3ProX) reported that LTM is still not enabled after the update and provided logs and video.
* Another user (@AyomideA-S) reported the same issue.
* The issue status remains open and requires further investigation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user reported a new issue with a page opening in the browser after every reboot.
* Another user confirmed experiencing the same issue.

common_issues.title: VS Code Extension Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting the VS Code extension to Pieces OS, particularly within remote environments like Docker containers. This is often resolved by manually setting the `pieces.customUrl` to the appropriate address, such as `http://host.docker.internal:1000`. The Pieces team is actively working on improving automatic detection and support for remote environments in future releases.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of Github Issue **Key points raised:** * User @malanciault created the issue. * Issue has been routed to the relevant support team. **Problems identified:** * User needs to provide details of the issue. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * User provided relevant issue details. **Current status/outcome:** * The support team has not yet followed up. * User can refer to resources listed for immediate help or track other similar issues. **Important details:** * User might find these issues helpful: [Can't connect from dev container](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269), [VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/489) and [Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/530) * Resources: Existing Issues, Documentation and YouTube Channel are listed for user reference. **Note:** This is a summary based on the limited details available in the conversation snippet provided.

related_issues.title: Can't connect from dev container
related_issues.text: Can't connect from dev container ### Software Pieces OS, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 9.0.7 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. # Issue description Hi, Pieces OS is working fine in VSCode (extension version: `v1.16.2`), until I load into a dev container. VSCode gives me these notifications: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/48d644e3-c170-4caf-8258-d96f2323c2cf) ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/a393edaf-8405-4581-9807-3ae093d078e3) Pieces explorer looks like this: # Attempted fixes I tried to turn off / disable macOS native firewall as well as [Lulu](https://objective-see.org/products/lulu.html) completely, but the issue still persists. Not sure how to make inbound firewall rule for port 1000 on macOS, where you need to specify an exact application associated with firewall rules. # One strange behavior Now, one thing is strange - **if PiecesOS is turned off before opening VSCode and I open a VSCode in dev container straight away, PiecesOS automatically starts and shows me the welcome window**: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/07cd8e60-1b29-4757-8204-c82d87cd39ce) Does it mean, that the VSCode extension inside dev container (i.e. docker container) can communicate with host and startup the application? If so, why does it fail to communicate further? ## Summary of GitHub issue conversation **Key points raised:** * Docker container can't reach Pieces OS, preventing VS Code extension from working. * `pieces.customUrl` setting should be used as workaround until issue is resolved. **Problems identified:** * VS Code extension can't automatically detect whether it's in a dev container or not. * Remote development environments (e.g., Gitpod) not fully supported. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * Setting `pieces.customUrl` to `http://host.docker.internal:1000`. * Adding a notification on startup when a remote environment is detected, linking to documentation on port forwarding. * Future improvements will enable automatic detection of dev containers and support for remote development environments. **Current status/outcome:** * The immediate issue is resolved using the workaround. * Future improvements are planned to provide a more seamless experience in dev containers and remote environments. **Additional notes:** * The `pieces.customUrl` setting will need to be manually set until the next release. * There is a proposal to allow specifying multiple URLs in the `pieces.customUrl` setting. * The issue has been marked as 'resolved' on GitHub.

related_issues.title: It's laggy and heavier, sometimes not responding in VSCode extension since major update to OS v11.0.0
related_issues.text:
It's laggy and heavier, sometimes not responding in VSCode extension since major update to OS v11.0.0
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

OS ver.11.0.2, Desktop App ver.3.3.2, VSCode Extension ver.2.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

This is performance issues. The overall performance is laggy, and its respons is laggy. It feels heavier than OS version below 11.0.0 . This performance is even worse on VSCode extension. I even need to delete one of my chat-this chat use file as context-because it caused it to not responding, I delete the chat using desktop application. If I can rate it performance, speed and lightness, if version below 11.0.0 is 10, then this new major update is about 4.5 to 4.9. Overall, this app is excellent, but it really need major improvement in performance issues.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Performance Issues

**Key Points:**

* User @dasyari reported performance issues with the Pieces app.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team.
* User was provided with helpful resources and links to similar issues.
* Pieces team member @mark-at-pieces reached out to schedule a call to understand the issue better.

**Problems Identified:**

* Performance issues within the Pieces app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Infrastructure improvements are planned to address performance issues.
* @mark-at-pieces is available to discuss the issue further with the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being actively addressed by the Pieces team.
* A call is scheduled between the user and the Pieces team member to discuss the issue in more detail.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation occurred on December 23, 2024.
* I am unable to provide information after November 2023, so this summary is based on the available information.

recommendations: **Prioritize LTM Engine Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring issue of users struggling to enable or utilize the Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine. This issue has a high frequency and directly impacts a key feature of the Pieces platform.

**Improve VS Code Extension Connectivity:** Address the challenges users face when connecting the VS Code extension, especially within remote environments like Docker containers. Enhance automatic detection mechanisms and provide clearer guidance on manual configuration options.

**Proactive Communication:**  For known issues like the LTM Engine and VS Code connectivity, proactively communicate workarounds or temporary solutions to users through in-app notifications, release notes, or support articles. This can help mitigate user frustration while waiting for permanent fixes.

**Gather Detailed User Feedback:**  For issues with lower activity levels but potential impact, like performance concerns, reach out to affected users to gather more detailed feedback and logs. This will aid in replicating and diagnosing the root cause.

**Enhance Documentation:** Ensure that the documentation, particularly regarding remote environments and troubleshooting connection issues, is up-to-date, comprehensive, and easily accessible within the application and on the Pieces website.
